page.title: 08Sir William Borlase School
page.content: {Sir William Borlase School}is{Marlow's only Grammar School. It was built in 1624. Sir William's son, Henry, was an M.P. for Marlow. It was built in memory of him. It has a total of 510 boys and 36 teachers. The original school had 24 boys and girls and one schoolmaster who was paid Â£12 a year with a room rent free. The children were chosen from the poor families. They were taught rading, writing and how to cast accounts. There are now many more subjects to choose from. Old punishments were to write out bible passages or they could be beaten. The punishment was given in{'The House of {Correction'}which stood next to the school. The original school had both boys and girls in it and in 1987 they will readmit girls. How many more old customs will they return to?
